com.marist.mscs721

Class RoomScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marist.mscs721.RoomScheduler

  • public class RoomScheduler
extends Object
    This class is the main portion for the RoomScheduler program. It is a console based interface the prompts a user to make a selection from the main menu. The user has several options to choose from such as add a room, remove a room, schedule a room, list the schedule, list the rooms, export the rooms and meetings to JSON, and import the rooms and meetings from JSON.
    Since:
    2017-01-26
    Author:
    Tom Ginader

    • Field Detail

      • keyboard

        protected static Scanner keyboard

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException
        Main method for the class. This is where the main menu is called, and the user is prompted to enter a number value that corresponds to one of the methods described above. After a number is entered, it then calls that specific function that takes a list of rooms as a parameter. This is also where the list of rooms is created.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • listSchedule

        protected static String listSchedule(ArrayList<Room> roomList)
        This method lists the schedules for a specified room. It calls getRoomName and the user is prompted to enter the room number for an existing room in the room list. The schedule for that room is then displayed.
        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        Returns:
        String an empty string

      • mainMenu

        protected static int mainMenu()
                       throws IOException
        This is the main menu for the program. It lists all of the options that the user can choose from, and then accepts the user's input for a number.
        Returns:
        int the user's number that they entered
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addRoom

        protected static String addRoom(ArrayList<Room> roomList)
                         throws IOException
        This method adds a room to the room list. It prompts the user for a room name and a room capacity. The information is then saved and added to a newly created room object. The room object is then added to the room list.
        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        Returns:
        String a string that displays the room name and that it was created successfully.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • removeRoom

        protected static String removeRoom(ArrayList<Room> roomList)
        This method removes a room from the room list. It prompts the user for the name of a room. It then compares that room name with the rooms in the room list to see if that room exists. If that room exists, it is then removed from the list.
        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        Returns:
        String a string that states the room was removed successfully.

      • listRooms

        protected static String listRooms(ArrayList<Room> roomList)
        This method lists the rooms in the room list. It iterates through each room in the room list and displays the room name and capacity to the user.
        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        Returns:
        String a string that displays how many rooms are in the room list

      • scheduleRoom

        protected static String scheduleRoom(ArrayList<Room> roomList)
        This method schedules a meeting for a specified room. It prompts the user for an existing room name. It then asks for a start date and time, and an end date and time. It then saves the dates and times as a Timestamp for the start and end dates/times.

        It then checks to see if there is any schedule conflict with an existing meeting. If there is, then the method returns an empty string.

        If there is no schedule conflict, then it prompts the user for a subject for the meeting. It then creates the meeting, and adds the meeting to the room.

        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        Returns:
        String an empty string

      • exportToJson

        protected static String exportToJson(ArrayList<Room> roomList)
                              throws IOException
        This method allows the user to export the room list to JSON so that they can save the room list for a later time. It uses gson to convert the roomlist into JSON, and then saves it to a file called "file.json" and stores it in the RoomScheduler folder.
        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        Returns:
        String a string that displays that the objects were successfully exported to JSON
        Throws:
        IOException

      • importFromJson

        protected static String importFromJson(ArrayList<Room> roomList)
                                throws IOException
        This method allows a user to import a JSON file into the program. It looks for a file name "file.json" in the RoomScheduler folder and converts it into an array. It then adds that array to the room list in the program.
        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        Returns:
        String a string that displays that the import was successful
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getRoomFromName

        protected static Room getRoomFromName(ArrayList<Room> roomList,
                                      String name)
        This method gets the room object based on the user inputted room name. It takes the room list and name and checks if the room is in the room list. If it is, then it returns the room.
        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        name - the name of the room that the user entered
        Returns:
        Room the room that was found in the room list

      • findRoomIndex

        protected static int findRoomIndex(ArrayList<Room> roomList,
                                   String roomName)
        This method is used to get the index of the room. The index can then be used to find a user specified room. The index starts at 0 and compares each room in the list to the user submitted room name. If the room is found, then it exits the for loop. If it is not found then it increments the room index.
        Parameters:
        roomList - the list of rooms that have been created
        roomName - the name of the room that the user entered
        Returns:
        int the roomIndex where the room is located

      • getRoomName

        protected static String getRoomName()
        This method prompts the user for a room name and returns the user's input.
        Returns:
        String the name of the room that the user entered.
